definition: to hand over/to pass on sth/to gradually increase or decrease/progressively

sentences.english: During the capture, the updated virtual machine disks are transferred back to the appliance.
sentences.chinese: 在捕捉期間，更新後的虛擬機磁盤將被傳遞迴設備。

sentences.english: Locks on folders are implicitly recursive.
sentences.chinese: 資料夾的鎖定是隱含遞迴。

sentences.english: That recursive nature is the infinite game.
sentences.chinese: 那個遞迴的本質無限賽局。

sentences.english: He hands over the little orange pumpkin. I put it back on the display table.
sentences.chinese: 他遞迴了小橙南瓜，我把它放到陳列臺上。

sentences.english: The doctor accepted and handed the flask back to the lawyer.
sentences.chinese: 醫生喝了一口，把酒瓶遞迴律師。

sentences.english: All traversals of the editing model are recursive.
sentences.chinese: 編輯模式的所有周遊都是遞迴性。

sentences.english: She hands the phone back, and goes to look.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩將手機遞迴，開始尋找。

sentences.english: Jake offers the bowl back to Tsu’tey.
I took the pad, wrote, and handed it back
sentences.chinese: 我拿走筆記，又寫了行字，然後遞迴給她。
